brand_info.name: Prada
brand_info.positioning: Intellectual, design-led luxury rooted in Milanese heritage, balancing avant-garde experimentation with rigorous craftsmanship.
brand_info.vision: With a thoughtful and pioneering vision, be a global leader in luxury while sustaining an unconventional dialogue and interpretation of the contemporary for planet, people and culture. citeturn0search1
brand_info.mission: Offer an unconventional dialogue and interpretation of the contemporary through products, experiences and culture, as an expression of a way of doing business for planet, people and culture. citeturn0search1
brand_info.origin_story: Founded in Milan in 1913 by Mario Prada with the opening of the first store in the Galleria Vittorio Emanuele II, initially focused on luxury travel articles and accessories crafted with sophisticated techniques and fine materials. citeturn0search3turn0search8

brand_values.brand_promise: A distinct point of view where luxury is defined by ideas, precision and materials, not ornament for its own sake.
differentiators: High fashion with cultural proximity (art, cinema, architecture)

psychographics.lifestyle: Urban, culturally engaged, design-literate individuals who value ideas, art and modernity as status signals.
psychographics.behavior: Invests in statement pieces, follows runway and culture, responds to conceptual campaigns over product-only ads.

tone_of_voice.communication_style: Concise, declarative, often editorial-minimal with room for interpretation.
tone_dos: Keep copy secondary to art direction

logo.primary_logo: PRADA wordmark in a high-contrast serif
logo.usage_rules: Logo appears clean and uncompromised, typically black on white or white on color/photography, with clear space and strong legibility.
logo.lockup_behavior: Centered or aligned to top/bottom margins; often oversized and treated as a graphic anchor rather than a signature.
logo.safe_area: Minimum padding equals at least the cap-height of the wordmark around all sides.

color_system.color_usage_rules: Base system is monochrome; accents are bold, flat or highly saturated (often red, cobalt, acid or pastel) used as conceptual fields or fashion-led color pops.

typography.primary_font: High-contrast serif (brand-equivalent to a modern Didone)
typography.secondary_font: Neutral grotesk sans-serif for supporting information

layout_principles.grid_system: Editorial grid with strong margin behavior
layout_principles.image_vs_text_balance: Image-led with logo acting as a compositional block
layout_principles.cta_placement: Rare; when present, small and subordinate
layout_principles.alignment: Centered logo with asymmetric image tension; frequent use of large negative areas

style.camera_feel: Fashion as scenario: a single frame that implies a story, often with controlled awkwardness or theatrical stillness.
style.pose_guidelines: Unforced but deliberate; poses can be angular, off-balance, or emotionally detached; occasional candid laughter used as contrast.
style.casting_attitude: Distinctive faces, strong individuality; mixed casting that reads intentional and contemporary, not tokenized.

technical.lighting: High-key studio, clean daylight, or hard directional light with crisp shadows depending on concept
technical.grain: Subtle to visible film grain when cinematic
technical.depth_of_field: Shallow to medium; background clarity used strategically for context or graphic flatness
technical.color_grading: Neutral-to-cool with deliberate accent color; occasional vintage warmth or chromatic boldness

model_casting.attitude: Self-possessed, slightly detached; emotion appears as puncture moments rather than constant warmth

product_presentation.hero_visibility: Product is present and readable but integrated into the concept; often one clear hero item per frame.
product_presentation.styling_approach: Sharp silhouettes, deliberate contrasts (texture, proportion, era-mixing), accessories used as graphic punctuation.

motion_rules.pacing: Editorial rhythm; moments feel like still photographs extended in time
motion_rules.transitions: Hard cuts or clean fades; typographic/title cards used sparingly

visual_dos: Use negative space as a design element
visual_donts: Generic luxury tropes (champagne, yachts) unless subverted

digital.tone_adjustment: Image-first with minimal captions; concept naming and collection identifiers; focus on cultural dialogue.

platform_behavior.Instagram: Graphic first frames, tight crops, bold logo moments, occasional behind-the-scenes culture cues
platform_behavior.Website: Editorial navigation, high-impact hero visuals, restrained UI
platform_behavior.Newsletter: Minimal text, strong hero image, clear product/category pathways

print.cover_rules: Full-bleed or strong negative space; PRADA wordmark as a dominant typographic element

logo_misuse_examples: Crowding the wordmark with other typography
